results.title: Your child is a genius
results.brief_description: Deals with the creative desire in every child to draw pictures of their impressions of the world about. The psychological and social values in children’s art are stressed. Samples of child art in the Brooklyn Museum are shown.

results.title: Your biological guide to AIDS
results.creator_credit: Stuart McDonald, Katherine Everett and BBC
results.brief_description: Presenters from the Bodymatters Team separate facts from fiction and reveal how much the worldwide experts know about AIDS and its transmission. They explore the challenges ahead and the possibilities of finding a vaccine and a cure. The program dispels some of the myths surrounding the disease and uses giant models of the body to explain the action of the AIDS virus on other healthy cells.

results.title: The Time has come
results.creator_credit: Jamil Simon, Jamil Simon Productions and Women's Action Alliance
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the ease and accessibility of a non-sexist approach to child rearing. Explores the non-sexist elements of the home environment as well as influences from outside the home such as television and school. Suggests ways for parents to expand future options for their children.

results.title: Your house in order?
results.creator_credit: Philip Owtram, David Evans and Millbank Films
results.brief_description: Deals with a neglected subject - industrial housekeeping - and the accidents that can be attributed either directly or indirectly to bad housekeeping methods. It sets out to promote the right attitude of mind.

results.title: The Time guardian
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Norm Wilkinson, Robert Lagettie, Chateau Productions Investments and International Film Management
results.brief_description: During the 24th Century a new city is launched into time to escape a polluted and dying earth. It must keep travelling to avoid the Jen-Diki, mutated descendants of the people they once were and the city’s natural enemy. After yet another attack, the city is forced to repair and recharge in a safe year and comes to rest in the 20th Century. Stars Tom Burlinson, Carrie Fisher, Dean Stockwell and Nikki Coghill.

results.title: Your biological guide to AIDS (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Caroline Godley, Alison Tucker, Vic Lockwood and BBC
results.brief_description: An informative question and answer format about AIDS presented by Mike Smith and Vicki Licorish. Discusses how the virus is transmitted; what it does to the body; how it affects your partner; the immune system; HIV; condom practice and protection. Includes interviews with AIDS sufferers.
